page.title: 13COMMUNITY LIFE IN BARKISLAND
page.content:
The{village shop}is perhaps the most important venue for the exchange of news, views, and plain gossip. Most of the local inhabitants call at the shop each day, and make their own contribution to the fund of news.
The school hall is used by {cub-scouts,}and by{brownies}and {guides.}It is also used for{pantomime rehearsals, by the{old people}for concerts and tea-parties. Many{church {activities}also take place at regular intervals.
The local{cricket club}is a most important centre for passing a pleasant social afternoon. Not least in popularity are the local{inns}and {pubs}which are frequented by locals and tourists alike.
